Load the two required data files (Florida-only MSA file and national 2024 metro report file), using “ISO-8859-1” encoding.
Strip commas/whitespace, remove $ sign, convert K / M suffixed numbers to true numeric values, returns int or float, otherwise None.
Find the first line having at least two non-empty comma-separated cells and treat it as header and keep subsequent lines until a line with <2 populated cells (cuts off footers/notes).
Drop all non-alphanumeric characters and lower-case the string for metropolitan area names, ensuring equivalent metropolitan area names match even if punctuation or spacing differs.

Create two normalised target strings that represent "Miami-Fort Lauderdale-West Palm Beach, FL Metropolitan Statistical Area" (slightly different punctuations), select the row in each DataFrame whose 'Metropolitan Area' value, after normalisation, equals its respective target string.
Extract '# of Reports' from both rows (and 'Reports per 100K Population’ from the second file), cast to int for numeric comparison.
Compare the two '# of Reports' values and print True if they are identical, False otherwise.
